required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Interactions Between Dolutegravir and Escalating Doses of Rifampicin
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Interactions Between Dolutegravir and Escalating Doses of Rifampicin

brief_summary.textblock: This is a drug interaction study in HIV negative, TB-monoinfected participants coming to the end of continuation phase of TB therapy, to study the pharmacokinetic changes to dolutegravir when administered with standard, medium and high dose rifampicin.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in pharmacokinetic parameter Cmin of dolutegravir
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 14, Day 28, Day 42, 5 weeks post anti-tuberculosis treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change in dolutegravir Cmin when dosed with standard, medium, high dose rifampicin

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pharmacokinetic parameter AUC of dolutegravir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 14, Day 28, Day 42, 5 weeks post anti-tuberculosis treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change in dolutegravir AUC when dosed with standard, medium, high dose rifampicin

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pharmacokinetic parameter Cmax of dolutegravir
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 14, Day 28, Day 42, 5 weeks post anti-tuberculosis treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change in dolutegravir Cmax when dosed with standard, medium, high dose rifampicin

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Grade 3 and above adverse events as assessed by DAIDS (corrected v2.1 July 2017)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of dolutegravir until study completion approximately 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Grade 3 and above adverse events as assessed by DAIDS (corrected v2.1 July 2017)

intervention.description: Dosed at 50 mg bd on 3 separate occasions with low, medium and high doses of rifampicin. Dosed at 50 mg od without rifampicin.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ability to give informed consent prior to participation
- Willing and able to comply with all study requirements
- Receiving standard doses of RIF and INH
- HIV antibody negative
- Male or non-pregnant, non-breastfeeding female
- Study participation will not extend length of ATT by more than 4 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 18 years
- Body weight < 50 kg
- eGFR < 60 mL/min
- Abnormal LFTs including ALT > 2.5 ULN
- HIV antibody positive
- Non-standard TB regimen (containing RHZE)
- Women of childbearing age unless using effective contraception
- Family history of sudden cardiac death
- Prior history of cardiac disease that precludes the use of low dose digoxin
- Medical or psychiatric condition that might affect participation in the study based on investigator judgement
- Regular consumption of grapefruit or grapefruit juice
- ECG abnormalities that preclude the use of low dose digoxin (intermittent complete heart block, second degree AV block, supraventricular arrhythmia associated with conducting pathways, ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation)
